p: Approximately 4 out of 5 respondents answered "Yes, definitely" or "Yes, probably" to the question "Do you think that the climate is changing because of human induced climate change to the extent that it will affect your environment?" ( Table 1) ( S7 Fig). In a model explaining the response to this question, the number of years the respondent had lived in the municipality is the most important explanatory variable ( Fig 5) ( S3 Table). The results also show that female respondents and those with university education more strongly believe that they have experienced the effects of climate change than male respondents and those without university education ( Fig 5) ( S3 Table). Respondents choosing the most important location because of the value profile "Environment" (ENV) statistically significantly more strongly believe in the local effects of climate change than other respondents and respondents choosing the most important location because of the "Place valuer" profile (PLV) statistically significantly less strongly believe in the local effects of climate change than the other respondents ( Fig 5) ( S3 Table).
